data.title: XRP Price Tries Desperately to Lift Off, But a Massive Amount of XRP Tokens Still Sit on Exchanges
data.description:
XRP (XRP-USD) is in a tough spot right now. On one hand, the charts show a pattern that usually leads to a 20% price jump. On the other hand, a massive amount of tokens is sitting on exchanges, acting like an anchor that keeps the price from lifting off. As of today, XRP's price is stuck around $1.44, even though more people are starting to feel positive about it.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Big Players Move Billion of Tokens

The main reason the price feels heavy is because of what the whales are doing. Since the start of 2026, big holders have moved 3.8 billion XRP onto the Binance exchange. When people see billions of tokens moving onto an exchange, they get nervous because it usually means those tokens are about to be sold.

This huge supply of tokens has created a glass ceiling at the $1.50 level. Every time the price tries to go higher, it hits this wall of sell orders. Until the market buys up these 3.8 billion tokens, it will be very hard for XRP to move past this point.

Regular Investors Start Buying the Dip

While the whales are busy moving tokens to exchanges, another group of investors is doing the opposite. Over the last ten days, about 200 million XRP has actually left Binance. This happens when people buy tokens and move them to their own private wallets for safekeeping.

Choosing to move tokens off exchanges is usually a sign that people believe the price will go up later. Even though the whales are providing the supply, regular buyers and long-term holders are slowly eating that supply. This is the main reason why the price has been moving sideways for over a week.

New Rules and Trade News Create Fear

The whole world is a bit nervous right now. On February 24, a new 15% global trade tariff went into effect in the US. This news sent a shockwave through the markets, making people want to hold cash instead of "risky" things like crypto.

The fear from these trade rules has made it hard for any coin to rally. Bitcoin and Ethereum have also been struggling, which pulls XRP down with them. However, XRP has one thing going for it: a new partnership with GOSH Charity. This deal helps people donate crypto to charity easily, which gives the token a real-world use that some other coins don't have.

At the time of writing, XRP is sitting at $1.4450.
data.author: Annika Masrani

data.title: Microsoft (MSFT) Faces Japan Cloud Probe as Azure Drives $100 Billion in Annual Revenue
data.description:
Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) is under review in Japan as the country's Fair Trade Commission looks into its cloud business. The probe centers on whether Microsoft limited how clients use its software on cloud platforms that compete with Azure.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Reports say the agency is checking if Microsoft made it harder to run its programs on rival clouds such as Amazon (AMZN) AWS and Alphabet (GOOGL) Google Cloud. The concern is that this could tilt the field in favor of Azure.

Microsoft Japan President Miki Tsusaka addressed the issue at a Bloomberg event in Tokyo. She said, "Japan is one of the most significant strategic markets for Microsoft, and everything we do is operated with integrity." She added, "I hope that is reflected in the market in terms of day-to-day practices." She did not comment on the details of the probe.

Meanwhile, MSFT shares rose nearly 3% on Wednesday, closing at $400.60. The rise followed Microsoft's agreement with Starlink.
data.author: Ran Melamed

data.title: These 2 Beaten-Down Stocks Could Stage a Comeback, Says Oppenheimer
data.description:
So much is going on, it's hard to know where to start. There are always doomsayers, but recent economic data can't be pleasing them. Q4 earnings are better than predicted, and with some 85% of the S&P-listed companies having reported, we can see that revenues are up almost 9% and earnings are up more than 12%.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Quarterly GDP growth has slowed, but remains sound at 1.4%. Analysts expect a bump when the Q1 numbers come in and the effects of the understated Federal Government shutdown finish rippling through.

The big news, however, was the Supreme Court decision striking down most of President Trump's tariff regime. That was the wildcard, and we still don't know how it will affect the game. The President has already indicated that he'll simply levy a global blanket tariff of at least 10%. In the meantime, businesses and importers who have already paid some $170 billion in aggregate tariffs to the US Treasury will be looking to pull some of that back.

Watching this situation from Oppenheimer, chief investment strategist John Stoltzfus sees reason for optimism – and a place to look for sound stock picks. He writes, "Many market participants are increasingly recognizing that indeed uncertainty remains at the core of the day-to-day life of the markets as it does in the lives of its participants. Periods of price volatility offer opportunity 'to catch babies thrown out with the bath water' in periods of market downdrafts and present opportunities to respond rather than opt for knee jerk reactions."

The stock analysts at Oppenheimer are running with this thesis – they've picked out beaten-down stocks that appear ready to bounce back in a resilient market environment, and their notes make interesting reading. Let's take a look at two of their choices, and with some help from the TipRanks database, we can see whether the general Street consensus aligns with the Oppenheimer analysts' view.  

Freshworks (FRSH)

The first stock on our list of Oppenheimer picks is a software-as-a-service company, Freshworks. Founded in 2010 in India, Freshworks builds and delivers software systems designed to 'uncomplicate' enterprise users' IT and customer service systems. IT and customer service are two of the vital digital functions in any modern enterprise, and Freshworks uses AI and intuitive management to simplify them both.

That approach has earned the company a solid audience. Freshworks boasts that it has over 74,000 customers in more than 120 countries; that last year, it saved its customers over 1.3 million work-hours in support workflows; and that its AI agents and copilots deliver measurable and significant improvements in productivity times and resolutions.

Freshworks can claim some major names on its customer list, including S&P Global, Klarna, Forbes, and Bridgestone. The company can also boast solid earnings and a trend of rising revenues. Nevertheless, the stock is down 40.5% year-to-date.

Much of that loss tracks back to the general threats facing the enterprise software sector. Competition is fierce in the industry, and the emergence of AI, especially agentic and generative AI models, is both a promise and a threat. The promise is that these technologies will open new vistas of opportunity for increased profits; the threat is that current customers will start to adopt the new AI models in-house and reduce the demand for SaaS operators' products.

For now, though, the company is reporting solid results. In 4Q25, the last period reported, Freshworks' revenue came to $222.7 million, up more than 14% year-over-year and beating the forecast by a $4 million margin. The company's bottom line of $0.14 per share in non-GAAP measures was 3 cents per share better than expected.

Those strong results form the starting point for Oppenheimer's Brian Schwartz, who writes of the software firm, "Freshworks delivered a good quarter in 4Q25. The quarter strength was driven by momentum across the EX business and AI products. 4Q25 results also show a record gross margin, and the top-line outperformance flowed through to higher profits. Negatively, 4Q and 2026 guidance show down operating margins as management invests for future growth. Also, 104% constant-currency NRR in 4Q and 105% 1Q guide indicates a meaningful recovery in expansions activity is further out, and may feed an AI bear narrative on Freshworks' seat-based model. Bottom Line: Freshworks is showing good consistency in revenue growth and profit margins, and generating a lot of cash. In our view, the latter supports management instituting greater capital returns to shareholders given low multiples and strong balance sheet."

The analyst goes on to rate FRSH stock as Outperform (Buy), with a $15 price target that indicates room for 106% upside potential in the next 12 months. (To watch Schwartz's track record, click here.)

Right now, Freshworks has 12 recent analyst reviews on file, and the 6-6 split between Buy and Hold gives the stock its Moderate Buy consensus rating. The shares are priced at $7.28, and their $12.89 average price target implies a 77% gain by this time next year. (See FRSH stock forecast.)
data.author: Michael Marcus

data.title: Nvidia or AMD: Which Is the Best Chip Stock Post-Earnings, Meta Deals?
data.description:
American chip giants Nvidia (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) both beat sales and earnings expectations in their fiscal fourth quarters. Moreover, both semiconductor companies have signed multiyear AI infrastructure deals with Meta Platforms (META), solidifying their positions in the booming AI market amid surging demand from hyperscalers like Meta, Microsoft (MSFT), and Google (GOOGL).

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Nvidia and AMD chips differ mainly in architecture, software ecosystems, and target strengths for gaming, AI, and data centers. Nvidia leads in high-end performance and AI dominance, while AMD focuses on value and capacity.

Based on TipRanks' Stock Comparison Tool, analysts have assigned a "Strong Buy" consensus to NVDA, while they remain cautiously optimistic on AMD's long-term prospects. Nonetheless, both stocks show similar upside potential over the next twelve months of around 35% to 37%, indicating strong share price appreciation ahead.
data.author: Sheryl Sheth

data.title: CoreWeave (CRWV) Will Report its Q4 Earnings Today. Here's What to Expect from the AI Stock
data.description:
Artificial intelligence (AI) cloud company CoreWeave (CRWV) is scheduled to announce its results for the fourth quarter of 2025 after the markets close on Thursday, February 26. CRWV stock has risen 37% year-to-date, driven by solid demand for data center infrastructure and robust AI spending. However, there have been some concerns about the company's high debt levels, customer concentration risks, and uncertainty about securing the funding needed for data center expansion.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Meanwhile, Wall Street expects CoreWeave to report a higher loss per share of $0.50 for Q4 2025 compared to $0.08 in the prior-year quarter. The consensus revenue estimate is $1.55 billion.

CoreWeave stock rose 9.3% on Tuesday following a Bloomberg report that the company is seeking to raise an $8.5 billion syndicated bank loan, backed by its $14.2 billion contract with Meta Platforms (META).

Analysts' Views Ahead of CoreWeave's Q4 Earnings

Roth Capital analyst Rohit Kulkarni reiterated a Buy rating on CoreWeave stock with a price target of $110. The 5-star analyst stated that he remains positive on CRWV stock heading into Q4 earnings, as he sees multiple catalysts ahead, including Meta Platforms/OpenAI data centers, GB300 cluster rollout, and potential software/product releases around Nvidia (NVDA) GTC event.

Kulkarni added that he will mainly focus on the following aspects:

  • Backlog and incremental bookings quality
  • Progress on powered-shell delivery and data center commissioning timelines
  • Capital spending pace, especially the Q1 2026 catch-up
  • Funding plans and discipline. In particular, insights on how Nvidia's $2 billion equity investment impacts the funding roadmap, cost of capital, and balance sheet flexibility.

Interestingly, Kulkarni ranks No. 645 among more than 12,100 analysts tracked by TipRanks, with a success rate of 53% and an average return per rating of 16.2% over a one-year period.

Meanwhile, Wells Fargo analyst Michael Turrin reiterated a Buy rating on CoreWeave stock with a price target of $125. The analyst noted that there is a lot of focus on CRWV's Q4 results, with near-term deals progressing as expected and the company's available capacity of more than 1GW supporting upside in its bookings.

Turrin expects CoreWeave to report Q4 revenue of $1.57 billion, modestly higher than the Street's estimate and towards the high-end of the outlook range of $1.49 billion to $1.59 billion. The analyst highlighted that, in its first three quarters as a public company, CoreWeave saw its revenue upside compared to consensus decline from 15% in Q1 to 10% in Q2 to 5% in Q3 2025. Turrin expects the Q4 beat to be similar to Q3 2025.

AI Analyst Is Cautious on CRWV Stock

TipRanks' AI Analyst has a Neutral rating on CoreWeave stock with a price target of $91, indicating 7.2% downside risk. The AI Analyst's cautious stance reflects heavy leverage and negative equity as well as ongoing losses with negative free cash flow, which overshadow strong revenue growth.

Here's What Options Traders Anticipate

Using TipRanks' Options Tool, we can see what options traders are expecting from the stock immediately after its earnings report. The expected earnings move is determined by calculating the at-the-money straddle of the options closest to expiration after the earnings announcement. If this sounds complicated, don't worry, the Options Tool does this for you.

According to TipRanks' Options Tool, options traders expect about a 15.81% move in either direction in CRWV stock in reaction to Q4 2025 earnings.
data.author: Sirisha Bhogaraju

data.title: Adobe Stock Is Trading at 15x Earnings. Is This an AI Casualty or Generational Opportunity?
data.description:
Adobe (ADBE) has been a powerhouse in creative software for years, building a high-margin platform that's deeply embedded in professional workflows. But that edge is now being questioned as generative AI starts to change how digital content gets made and shared. A stock that once felt like a steady blue chip is now being treated as a stand-in for bigger concerns about disruption across the SaaS space.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Over the past few weeks, I've delved into the underlying economics of the creative ecosystem to examine whether the stock's brutal sell-off can be justified. In my view, the market is pricing in structural damage that doesn't align with how value actually accrues in this industry. For those reasons, I remain bullish on the stock, and I view it as a generational opportunity.
data.author: Nikolaos Sismanis

data.title: Beyond Meat Earnings Ahead: Options Traders Brace for 35% Move in BYND Stock
data.description:
Beyond Meat (BYND), whose shares trade below the $5 level, is expected to release its fourth-quarter results in early March, and the options market is pointing to a very volatile reaction. Based on options pricing, traders are expecting a 35.14% move in either direction in BYND stock after the Q4 2025 report. That is far larger than the stock's average post-earnings move (in absolute terms) of about 7.25% over the past four quarters.

data.title: DeepSeek Snubs Nvidia, AMD for New AI Model Launch, Gives Huawei Early Access
data.description:
Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) startup DeepSeek has not provided U.S. chip giants Nvidia (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) with early access to the pre-release version of its upcoming flagship model, V4. According to Reuters, DeepSeek has shared the pre-release version with domestic chip companies, including Huawei Technologies. The move comes amid intense competition between China and the U.S. to establish their dominance in the AI market.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

DeepSeek rattled U.S. AI stocks in January 2025 with its low-cost R1 AI model.

DeepSeek Chooses Domestic Chip Companies for Early Access to V4

DeepSeek's decision to give Chinese chipmakers a head start over their U.S. counterparts reflects the fierce rivalry between the two countries as they compete to lead the AI market. The move marks a departure from industry practice of sharing pre-release versions of major models with prominent chipmakers to ensure the software performs well on widely used hardware platforms.

Reuters cited Ben Bajarin, CEO of research firm Creative Strategies, who feels that DeepSeek's decision to withhold early access to V4 from Nvidia and AMD reflects the Chinese government's efforts to "try to keep U.S. hardware and models disadvantaged" in the country.

DeepSeek has seen significant interest since its emergence in the AI space in January 2025. Its models have been downloaded more than 75 million times on the open-source platform Hugging Face. The intense competition from Chinese open-source models has sparked concerns in the U.S. over the export of advanced U.S. chips. Last year, the Trump administration allowed the export of Nvidia's H20 and AMD's MI308 AI inference chips to China, though access to more advanced chips remains restricted.

Interestingly, earlier this week, Reuters reported that a senior Trump administration official said that DeepSeek may have trained its latest AI model on Nvidia's most advanced AI chip, Blackwell, even though the export of these chips to China is banned.

Wall Street's Take on NVDA and AMD Stocks

TipRanks' Stock Comparison Tool offers a quick snapshot of ratings and price targets for Nvidia and AMD stocks.

Currently, Wall Street has a Strong Buy consensus rating on Nvidia, with the average NVDA stock price target of $268.57 indicating 37.3% upside potential. On Wednesday, Nvidia reported better-than-expected results for the fourth quarter of Fiscal 2026, reflecting continued strength in demand for its AI GPUs (graphics processing units).

Meanwhile, Advanced Micro Devices scores a Moderate Buy consensus rating, with the average AMD stock price target of $286.04 indicating about 36% upside potential.
data.author: Sirisha Bhogaraju

data.title: Render Token, a Crypto Investment Tied to AI Computing, Poised for Growth
data.description:
The race for artificial intelligence dominance has an overlooked battlefield: raw computing power. While investors focus on model developers and chip manufacturers, a quieter infrastructure layer has been expanding on blockchain rails. Render Network (RNDR-USD) operates a decentralized marketplace that connects GPU owners with users who need compute power for rendering and artificial intelligence workloads. In a crypto market crowded with speculative narratives, Render stands out for linking token economics directly to real demand for processing capacity.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

For investors seeking indirect exposure to the AI buildout, RENDER offers a differentiated way to participate in the trend.

A Marketplace Built for the Compute Crunch

Studios producing visual effects, developers training machine learning models, and companies running inference workloads all face the same constraint: access to high performance GPUs remains expensive and uneven through traditional cloud providers. Platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AMZN) and Google Cloud (GOOGL) still dominate the market, but price volatility and capacity limits during peak demand periods have become recurring challenges. The surge in GPU demand from AI workloads has only deepened that strain.

Render addresses this gap by aggregating unused GPU capacity from a global network of node operators and matching it with buyers through a decentralized system. Instead of relying on centralized data centers, the protocol creates a marketplace where underutilized hardware can be activated on demand. Industry research suggests a meaningful share of installed GPU capacity worldwide sits idle for long periods, creating an opening for networks that can mobilize that excess supply efficiently.

The timing favors this model. The global artificial intelligence market was valued in the hundreds of billions of dollars in 2025 and is projected to approach the trillion dollar range before the end of the decade, according to Statista. Render has already processed workloads for visual effects studios, gaming firms, and machine learning teams. That blend of creative and technical users supports the case that the network is serving production grade use cases rather than experimental traffic.

However, in line with other crypto prices in recent months, RNDR-USD has dropped 25% in the past three months.
data.author: Hillary Remy

data.title: Stock Market News Today, 2/26/26 – U.S. Stock Futures Wobble amid Nvidia's Lukewarm Market Response
data.description:
U.S. stock futures wobbled early Thursday as traders parsed chip giant Nvidia's (NVDA) Q4 results. Futures on the Nasdaq 100 (NDX), the S&P 500 (SPX), and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) were down 0.03%, 0.04%, and 0.15%, respectively, at 5:29 a.m. EST on February 26.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

During Wednesday's regular trading, the three major indexes closed higher as tech and software stocks rebounded from an AI-driven selloff. Oracle (ORCL) rose 1.2%, and all members of the "Magnificent Seven" closed in the green. The DJIA gained 0.6%, the Nasdaq Composite surged 1.26%, and the S&P 500 added 0.81%.

After markets closed, Nvidia posted solid Q4 FY26 results, beating on both sales and earnings expectations. Nonetheless, its shares barely moved, reflecting cautious market sentiment given the company's outsized sway over tech stocks and major indexes like the Nasdaq.

Turning toward economic reports, weekly jobless claims data will be released Thursday, followed by the January Producer Price Index (PPI) report on Friday.

On the earnings front, notable companies reporting today include CoreWeave (CRWV), D-Wave Quantum (QBTS), Block (XYZ), SoundHound AI (SOUN), Baidu (BIDU), and Dell Technologies (DELL).

Notably, the U.S. 10-year Treasury yield was up, floating near 4.05%. WTI crude oil futures were trending lower, hovering near $64.85 per barrel as of the last check. Additionally, the Gold Spot U.S. dollar price increased to nearly $5,186 per ounce on Thursday.

Elsewhere, European indexes opened higher today amid a slew of corporate earnings releases.

Asia-Pacific Markets Trade Mixed

Asia-Pacific markets traded mixed on February 26, as global traders digested Nvidia's results.

Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index dropped 1.44%. In China, the Shanghai Composite fell 0.01%, while the Shenzhen Component rose 0.47%. Meanwhile, Japan's Nikkei added 0.29%, and the Topix gained 0.97%.
data.author: Sheryl Sheth
